name: Catchment hydrology
short_description: Land uses alter water quantity and quality delivered to the stream.
long_description: Represents watershed-scale drivers that change runoff, infiltration, and pollutant delivery. It reflects how land cover and management shape the volume and timing of water entering the stream network.

name: Surface water storage
short_description: Natural or artificial storage attenuates flows and increases residence time.
long_description: Represents the capacity of wetlands, ponds, and floodplain features to store water. Storage moderates peak flows and supports baseflow by slowing runoff.

name: Reach inflow
short_description: Local inputs alter magnitude, timing, and quality of flow.
long_description: Captures tributaries, ditches, pipes, and other local inflows that change discharge or water quality at the reach scale.

name: Streamflow regime
short_description: Characteristic flow pattern that shapes habitat and transport.
long_description: Represents the timing, magnitude, frequency, and duration of flow events that structure physical and ecological processes.

name: Low flow and baseflow dynamics
short_description: Maintains wetted habitat and moderates conditions during low water.
long_description: Represents how low flows sustain habitat, temperature moderation, and water quality during dry periods.

name: High flow dynamics
short_description: Drives erosion and channel maintenance during peaks.
long_description: Represents the energy of high flows that mobilize sediment, shape channels, and connect to floodplains.

name: Floodplain connectivity
short_description: Lateral exchange supports nutrient cycling and habitat.
long_description: Represents how often and how effectively the channel connects with its floodplain to exchange water, sediment, and organic matter.

name: Hyporheic connectivity
short_description: Surface-subsurface exchange supports temperature and nutrient regulation.
long_description: Represents exchange between surface water and shallow subsurface flow paths that influence temperature, nutrients, and habitat.

name: Channel evolution
short_description: Changes in channel dimensions and slope reflecting adjustment.
long_description: Represents the stage of channel adjustment driven by legacy impacts, altered flows, or sediment imbalance.

name: Channel and floodplain dynamics
short_description: Bank processes and planform dynamics that affect complexity.
long_description: Represents lateral migration, bar formation, and floodplain building that create channel complexity.

name: Sediment continuity
short_description: Balanced sediment supply and transport maintaining form and habitat.
long_description: Represents whether sediment supply, transport, and storage are in balance for the reach and watershed.

name: Bed composition and bedform dynamics
short_description: Substrate and bedforms (and wood effects) supporting habitat and exchange.
long_description: Represents the size, sorting, and structure of bed materials and bedforms that support habitat and hyporheic exchange.

name: Light & thermal regime
short_description: Regulates temperature and energy inputs shaping chemistry.
long_description: Represents shading, solar input, and thermal buffering that influence water temperature and ecosystem metabolism.

name: Carbon processing
short_description: Organic matter dynamics supporting food webs and metabolism.
long_description: Represents inputs, storage, and breakdown of organic matter that drive ecosystem respiration and production.

name: Nutrient cycling
short_description: N and P transformations controlling productivity and water quality.
long_description: Represents uptake, retention, and transformation of nutrients within the stream corridor.

name: Water & soil quality
short_description: Contaminants and constituents influencing chemical condition.
long_description: Represents chemical stressors in water and soils that affect aquatic life and system health.

name: Habitat provision
short_description: Physical habitat diversity supporting life stages and taxa.
long_description: Represents the variety and quality of physical habitats that support organisms across life stages.

name: Population support
short_description: Survival, reproduction, and movement of key taxa.
long_description: Represents the capacity of the reach to sustain populations, including access to spawning and rearing areas.

name: Community dynamics
short_description: Balanced assemblages of native taxa and resilience.
long_description: Represents community composition, diversity, and invasive pressure within the reach.

name: Watershed connectivity
short_description: Longitudinal and lateral connectivity enabling recovery.
long_description: Represents connectivity that enables recolonization, gene flow, and recovery after disturbance.
